ags:resource.dc:title: The analysis of performance in the wood processing industry through ratio indicators

dc:title.dcterms:alternative: Analýza výkonnosti drevospracujúceho priemyslu prostredníctvom pomerových ukazovateľov

dc:creator.ags:creatorCorporate: Technical University in Zvolen, T.G. Masaryka 24, 960 53 Zvolen, Slovak Republic, email: sujova@tuzvo.sk

dc:description.dcterms:abstract: Wood processing industry (WPI) is a sector based on renewable natural resources of wood raw material. It is therefore able of sustainable growth and be competitive on the international markets. The interest of the European Union is to build economy based on renewable natural resources, resulting in the need to pay increased attention to the development and support of the WPI. The aim of the paper is to evaluate the level and development of sectorial performance of WPI in the Czech Republic, the Slovak Republic and Austria in subsectorial structure for a period of ten years. System of indicators measuring sectorial performance was set up to reach the goal. Achieved results in indicators have shown that the performance of Slovak and Czech WPI is in comparison with Austrian WPI is not much lower, except labour productivity which is more than double-low and value added rate.
